title: Bug 12906 - Unable to open file in another editor if already opened in one (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906 - Currently, if a file is already opened in one editor, it cannot be opened in another editor. This behavior needs to be changed so that an error message is displayed when attempting to open the file in a second editor.
OB: Currently, when a file is opened in one editor, it cannot be opened in another editor. No warning or error message is displayed.
EB: After opening a file in one editor, if an attempt is made to open it in another editor, a warning message should be displayed stating that opening the file in multiple editors may result in data loss, and asking if the user wants to proceed or cancel the action.
SR:
To reproduce this issue: 
1. Make sure you have an associated Windows editor for your Java file. If not, go to the file explorer, double click on any Java file, and select WordPad or Notepad as the default editor for all Java files.
2. In the Java perspective, right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'. A Notepad or WordPad window will open with the Java file.
3. Close the Notepad or WordPad window.
4. Go to the Java perspective and open a Java file by simply double clicking on it. The file will be opened in the workbench.
5. Right click on the Java file and select 'Open With' -> 'System Editor'.

Expected Result: A warning message should be displayed, stating that opening the file in multiple editors may result in data loss, and asking if the user wants to proceed or cancel the action. Currently, nothing happens when trying to open the file in another editor.
